item.title: Get up to 77 percent off NordVPN two-year plans for Labor Day

review.headline_rewrite: Get up to 77 percent off NordVPN two-year plans for Labor Day
bullets: Read more about how we evaluate products.
A Prime plan additionally comes with encrypted cloud storage or NordProtect, which insures you against identity theft and monitors dark web activity.
When Engadget’s Sam Chapman reviewed NordVPN earlier this year, he praised its excellent download speeds, exclusive features and extensive server network.
While it doesn't quite make the cut in our guide to the best VPNs available right now, it generally performed well in speed tests and Threat Protection Pro is really worth having.

item.title: Escape from Tarkov is finally coming to Steam 'soon,' developer says

review.headline_rewrite: Escape from Tarkov is finally coming to Steam 'soon,' developer says
bullets: Following news that Escape from Tarkov is escaping its perpetual beta, the pioneering extraction shooter is also about to make its debut on Steam.

Nikita Buyanov, head of the Battlestate Games studio that developed Escape from Tarkov, confirmed on X that the game's Steam page "will be available soon," only teasing that the full details will come later.
The Steam page for Escape from Tarkov isn't live yet, and with only vague details to go off of, longtime fans already have burning questions.
Most importantly, existing players are eager to know if they will have to buy the game again on Steam and how this change will affect the ongoing cheating problem.
The controversy boiled down to owners of the Edge of Darkness edition claiming they should have access to the new content, but the studio argued that it isn't classified as DLC.
In the end, Buyanov apologized for the debacle and promised the PvE mode would be available for anyone who purchased the Edge of Darkness package.

30, 2025

item.title: AI warning: 10 things you should never share with ChatGPT and other chatbots

review.headline_rewrite: AI warning: 10 things you should never share with ChatGPT and other chatbots
bullets: Artificial intelligence chatbots like ChatGPT are rapidly changing the way people interact with technology.
From answering quick questions and drafting emails to offering companionship and emotional support, these tools are becoming a daily presence in many lives.
Experts warn that oversharing with AI carries serious risks, including privacy breaches, identity theft, and misuse of personal or sensitive information.
Unlike a human conversation, interactions with AI are not confidential, and what you share may be stored, analysed, or even exposed.

10 things that you should never discuss with AI chatbots
1.

Personal information
Details like your full name, home address, phone number, or email may seem harmless but can be pieced together to track your online identity.

item.title: China and India pledge to be 'partners not rivals' at security summit

review.headline_rewrite: China and India pledge to be 'partners not rivals' at security summit

bullets:
Grammarly launches new AI agents to assist students and professionals with writing tasks
Grammarly has introduced eight new AI agents within its AI writing surface, 'docs,' designed to aid students and professionals with diverse writing tasks.
These agents offer functionalities like citation finding, plagiarism checking, and AI detection, alongside features predicting reader reactions and providing rubric-based feedback.
This launch signifies Grammarly's move towards agent-based AI to enhance writing across various platforms.
